Prompt: Hi, I need to be able to set capacity limits by department as well as a capacity limit by the whole office.  Is it possible?
Completion: Hi Franco,     Thanks for reaching out.     As it turns out, AttendanceBot supports capacity limits assigned only to office level but not department level. However, I can definitely understand why this would be handy, though! I will pass it on to the product team and add your vote to this one.     If you want to set up limits on office capacity, here's a help article for your reference:  https://attendancebot.freshdesk.com/a/solutions/articles/17000117213   ​   Hope this was helpful! Do let us know if you need any other info, we're just an email away :)   Cheers,  Moira

Prompt: Can you provide me insight to how reporting works? Can I get reports within Slack? Are there commands I can execute to request this?

I heard back from the engineering team and their findings for Qusai Hijazen are listed below:      Total of 14 leaves were allotted to Qusai Hijazen at the time of joining. He took the following leaves -                     1 day leave - 14th Dec                0.5 day leave - 29th Dec                3 day leave - 29th Dec                Total leaves taken = 4.5      At the end of 2021, his balance becomes = Total allotted leave - Total leaves taken= 14-4.5 = 9.5  At the start of 2022, he is awarded 14 more leaves - making his new balance 9.5 +14 = 23.5   Hope this was helpful. Prompt: Dear Support     When we are using the leave type "working from office" we need to write a comment and specify in which office we will be working (Zürich or Zug). The confirmation from AB gets a bit confusing, because in the confirmation the office we are allocated to is also listed. See attachment. Would it be possible that with for this leave type the office we are allocated to can be taken out and only the comment is shown?    Thank you and have good start in 2022  Andrea
Completion: Hi Andrea,     Happy new year :D     Considering you have assigned the office to all your employee when they apply from Work from office leave, the app will consider their default office only. However, we have a workaround that can help you.      If an employee from Zurich is planning to work from Zug office, they can apply for leave "Working remotely" and add the office name "Zug office" as a comment and the app will announce it accordingly.   ​  Sounds good?   Cheers,  ​Thea

Prompt: Hello,     I need to adjust the carry over amounts for a one time only (override the carry over amount). How can I adjust the carry over amount for year end only?     Thank you,  Joanne Blessin
Completion: Hi Joanne,     Thanks for writing in.     Carryover of leaves can be controlled by the accrual settings by setting the Rollover in Days number, the number you assign here is the number of leaves that get carried over if any user has a remaining balance for that leave type.      FYI- The carryover happens as per the accrual period if your leave type has accrual set to annually then the rollover will happen once a year.   Cheers  Aaron

Prompt: Dear support team     I have a few employees that are part timers, when they enter 1 week holiday they only need 4 days from their quota for 1 week instead of 5 days. How can they enter their holidays for 1 week and have the correct balance afterwards?     Thank you and kind regards  Andrea
Completion: Hi Andrea,     Thanks for writing in.     I understand your concern here and the best way to apply for leave, in this case, is by using the exact dates in the leave command for example- Vacation from 10/01/2022 to 13/01/2022, this way the app will understand the correct dates & mark the vacation for just 4 days rather than the entire week.     FYI- There's no distinction in leave & quotas for part-time and full time employees.     I hope this clears your doubt.   Cheers  Aaron

Subject: 4 quick tips to get more out of AttendanceBot

 



Hi Madhur,

While you continue to explore possibilities with AttendanceBot, I thought you'd appreciate 4 quick tips to help hasten your discovery. 

1.    Get some teammates involved - AttendanceBot is truly a team tool, so its magic takes root with scale. Chat ‘introduce’ to the bot to start building your pilot team.

2.    Browse command options - message 'cheat sheet' to bring up a list of common commands. As an admin, you can even tailor this document to your team!

3.    Customize your experience - Have you explored the settings panel yet? From reminders and permissions to custom leaves  and approval workflow to project and client tracking, you can customize pretty much everything. Just message ‘settings’ to get behind the scenes.

4.    Announcements - Add @attendancebot to a team to stay in the loop with who's clocked in, who's on break, who has upcoming time off, who has a birthday, or your own custom reminders. 

There is - of course - plenty more to consider like employee docs, shared calendars, or Gusto integration, but these tips should be enough to warm up the engines. 

As always, I'm here for any questions you have, or you can  <https://t.dripemail2.com/c/eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..ZpCRtFAp9iv9LfulcP1RiVr9oV7p-zkM_EesFrLmH8Y> schedule a quick call to dive deeper on any of these topics.

Sarah

Completion: Hi Moira,     Thanks for reaching out.     We noticed that AttendanceBot currently is not added to any of you slack channels, which is why the AttendanceBot announcements are not appearing on any of the channels.   ​   To add AttendanceBot to a channel, you could simply type the command "/invite @AttendanceBot" to the required channel. To set up channel notifications, you could simply head to AttendanceBot dashboard-->Notifications-->Channel Notifications. I have also added a few screenshots for your reference.   ​   Also, we have upgraded your to the Better Plan- so now you should have the access to time tracking feature.   Please access the dashboard, and do let us know if you need any other info - we're just an email away :)  ​   Cheers,  Moira

Prompt: Hi       Could someone help me with the following:     - What does "Create employee level copy" in the leave settings   - What happens when in the holiday settings at "max accural allowed" 365 stands, does the balance automatically change?  - I saw that the balance changed for the settings paternity leave and for family care leave automatically with strange addings or deductions, such as 0.833 etc. although we didn't make any manual changes, why does this happen? See attachment.     Looking forward to your help.     Kind regards Andrea
Completion: Hi Andrea,     Thanks for writing in.     The employee level quotas are changes in leave quotas for a particular employee only, this happens when you make changes in People>> Personnel >> Quotas & balances section of the dashboard for a particular user.   ​  Also, Max Accrual Allowed in days refers to the maximum number of leaves which the user can accrue in a month. If you set it equal to the Annual Leave Count In Days, it would mean that all the leaves left over with the user in that month, will lapse and he will only get the fresh number of leaves the next month.     I checked the quotas for Family care leave & can see that you have made some adjustments in the quotas on an employee level for yourself, I've attached a snapshot of the adjustment logs for your reference.     If you are facing issues configuring quotas for your team you can refer to this article for reference: https://attendancebot.freshdesk.com/a/solutions/articles/17000051255  Cheers,  Aaron   Cheers

Prompt: Is there a way to turn off manager approval for time off tracking?
Completion: Hi Jessica,     Yes, you certainly can. Just head to the settings dashboard by typing "Settings". Once you are on it, go to vacation management --> leave types and quotas --> select the leave type (click on the pencil icon) --> accrual settings. You need to toggle off "Approval required" and it's done    ​  Can you give this a try?   Cheers,  Thea

Prompt: Can we manually add leave credits of an employee?
Completion: Hi Camille,     Hope your week is shaping up well!     Here are the answers you are looking for:     - Currently, you can schedule 3 reports i.e payroll, timesheet, and vacation. But that's a great suggestion :) I will relay this feedback to our product team and add your vote to it     - You can certainly add leave balance to any leave if the balance is set to "Limited". Just head to the settings dashboard by typing settings and going to people tab. Once you are on it, select the employee you wish to add the credits too --> select leave type --> adjustments. You can then add or subtract and hit save.      ​Hope this clarifies the doubt :)    Cheers,  Thea

Cheers  Aaron

Completion: Hi Trish,     Thanks for reaching out.     You could create a leave type on an employee level, so that only she could apply for it. Here is the step by step process you could follow to assign her maternity leaves.      Head to AttendanceBot dashboard--> Vacation Management-->Leaves-->Leave Types & Quotas.  Create a leave type called "Maternity Leave", add required keywords and hit save.  Now switch the toggle from "Active" to "Inactive" for this leave type.  Head to People-->Personnel and search for the required employee to open their profile.  Click on "Leaves & Balances" and select the arrow next to Maternity Leave.  Under Settings, add the count for maternity leaves and hit save.      I have also attached a few screenshots for your reference :) Can you please give it a try and let me if it works for you?   Cheers,  Moira

Prompt: minasl needs to teport to me. she is trying to put in for a  sick dsyv
Completion: Hi Kathryn,     Thanks for reaching out.     I was able to go through her interactions with AttendanceBot, and my findings are listed below:      On 3rd Jan 2022: AttendanceBot prompted Minaal that "It seems your manager USER_MENTION has been deactivated from your team. Please state the username of your new manager. You can give me the `@username` e.g. `@john`. If you don't have a manager, reply with `NA`."  After this - multiple occasions in Jan and Feb, she tried checking her balance and applying leaves. However, AttendanceBot prompted her back to update her manager in order to continue.  On 3rd Feb 2022: She typed in "NA" to this prompt - which assigned herself as the manager.   On 25th Feb & 2nd Mar: She applies for Sick leave which gets approved and the notification is sent to her as she was the assigned manager.      I now see that her manager has been correctly updated to you i.e Kathryn. Going forward, you would be notified of her leaves.  Hope this was helpful. Do let us know if you need any other info, we're just an email away :)   Cheers,  Moira

Prompt: Our contract is coming due and we would like to switch from annual billing to monthly.  Please assist, thank you.
Completion: Hi Chris,     ​Thanks for writing in.     Could you help me understand the reason as to why you want to shift from the annual to the monthly billing cycle? While we do offer both monthly and the annual options, the monthly billing cycle has a higher per user pricing and is less likely to be cost effective for you.     If you renew for the annual plan you'd get a 20% discount compared to monthly. I can further discount your pricing by 13% if you choose to renew for 18 months.   ​   If you go for the monthly billing cycle, you would be paying $804 for 12 months. However, if you renew at the discounted price for 18 months, you'd only be paying $846.     ​Looking forward to your response :)    Cheers,  Moira

However, if you want we can change your calendar year accrual date from January to July.     Let me know if you want us to make this change.   Cheers  Aaron

When the number of people using AttendanceBot exceeds 5, the system will prompt you to sign up for a paid plan and at that time you can pick which ever plan works for you. Here's the pricing page link for your reference: https://www.attendancebot.com/T97GJHA8H/pricing/     For now, enjoy all the features completely for free.   Do let me know if you have any other questions :)    Cheers,  Moira

Completion: Hi Chin,     Hope you are doing well.      Any employee/manager who will be interacting with the app is considered an active user of AttendanceBot. In the example you mentioned, all 5 of them will be considered as active users even though the manager or admin will be supervising the clockes of the employees.   Also, AttendanceBot is free up to 5 users and if you cross the mark, you will have to subscribe to either of our plans   Cheers,  Thea

Prompt: Why are people outside of my domain being pulled in? For example, users that don't have .am=dminwithin.com domain should not be pulled in on Personnel List

Anyone who joins your slack workspace gets acquired by AttendanceBot as a user, you can choose to invite them from the People>> Invite page, however, you can disable the 'Activate New User' setting from the basic settings page so that no new user gets acquired as a user in the team. I've attached a sample snapshot for your reference.      Cheers  Aaron

4.     Announcements - Add @attendancebot to a team to stay in the loop with who's clocked in, who's on break, who has upcoming time off, who has a birthday, or your own custom reminders.

There is - of course - plenty more to consider like employee docs, shared calendars, or Gusto integration, but these tips should be enough to warm up the engines.

Prompt: Team status is not sending proper notifications for leaves to the channel we have setup within slack. Each day the channel tells us that no one is on leave, but this is incorrect as the calendar inside the app shows correctly.
Completion: Hi Dustin,     Thanks for reaching out.     I see that for the leave type "Vacation", the setting "Show employee available" is switched ON. Since this setting is ON, AttendanceBot is considering employees on Vacation as available and not triggering the required notifications.  ​   Can you try switching this toggle OFF and hit save? I have attached a few screenshots for your reference.  Please give this a try and let me know if this works for you :)   Cheers,  Moira

Prompt: is there a way to prevent employees from clocking in before a shift starts?
Completion: Hi George,  ​   Thanks for reaching out.     As it turns out, you cannot prevent an employee from clocking-in before the shift starts. I can definitely understand why this would be handy, though! I will pass it on to the product team and add your vote to this one.     You could however, set up "Upcoming shift notifications" so that all the employees will be notified for their upcoming shifts and accordingly punch in, here's the direct link for you : https://www.attendancebot.com/accounts/leave/notifications/  I have also attached a screenshot for your reference.     Please give this a try and let me know if this works for you :)  ​   Cheers,  Moira

Prompt: It is giving errors when employees try to submit for leave when they do not have a shift scheduled for that time period. Is this avoidable?
Completion: Hi Austin,     Thanks for reaching out     The engineering team did inform me that there indeed is a backend setting which will allow users to apply for leaves even if they do not have shifts assigned for that day.  Can you please confirm if you want us to enable this from the backend?   Looking forward to hearing your thoughts on this :)   Cheers,  Moira

Prompt: Hi, attendancebot has stopped giving my team reminders to clock in after a break or lunch. Is there a setting that has changed or a way to re-set that up? Thanks!

Prompt:
Hi there, 

I would like to test the notifications but I can not seem to get them to send to a channel of my selection
Completion: Hi Georgia,     Hope your week is shaping up well :D     ​To answer your questions:      1) Notification: You need to invite the app in your channel for it to start interacting. You can do that by going to the channel and typing "/invite @attendancebot". I can see you have added punch card notification to your "Workflow test" channel. Are you not getting notifications for this?     2) You need to deactivate users from your dashboard and the free plan will be auto-assigned to your account. Head to the dashboard and go to people --> personnel --> Click on the inactive button on the profile tile of the employee you wish to deactivate.    Cheers,  Thea

Completion: Hi Isin,     ​You are currently part of the free plan as you have 3 users in your account. Once you cross the 5-user mark, AttendanceBot will ask you to subscribe to either of the plans. You can check out the plans here.      And if you are looking at setting up leave quotas and balances, you can set up employee level quotas, that's part of the "PRO" plan however as you are on the free plan, you have access to all the features of the app.      ​Talking about the set up, you can do that using the settings panel by typing "Settings" to the app. Once you open the dashboard, head to people --> personnel --> click on the profile of the employee you wish to make edit.        You can now assign quotas. Prompt: Hi. I have a question regarding pricing. We do have quite a bit of users in our Slack but many of them are external users that we have to have as full  members. How can I exclude them from the member counts when it comes to pricing?
Completion: Hi Espen,     You can deactivate them using the AttendanceBot dashboard and you won't be billed for it.   Here's how you can deactivate them.      Head to the settings panel by typing "Settings" to the app and following the URL. Once you are on it, go to people --> personnel. Just click on "Inactive" next to the profile and they will be deactivated.     ​  Can you give this a try?   Cheers,  Thea

Prompt: If I am a manager can I enter leave time in for my employees or do they have to submit it?
Completion: Hi Ryan,     Thanks for reaching out.  ​   I see that you are using AttendanceBot on web version - which currently does not support manager applying leave on their employee's behalf. So, the employees would need to submit for leave on their own.     However, AttendanceBot on the platforms like Slack/MS Teams/G Chat supports both an employee submitting there leave as well as manager applying on their behalf. If you have any of these platforms - you could install AttendanceBot on them and get started.  ​   Hope this was helpful, do let me know if you need any other info - we're just an email away :)   ​   Cheers,  Moira

Prompt: need to add another user.  I cant.
Completion: Hi Dallas,     Thanks for reaching out to us over the chat.     In order to add a new user to AttendanceBot, you need to first add that user as a member of the MS Teams team where the app is installed, once done the new user gets acquired by the app & you can invite the user from the People >> Invite page of the settings panel so that they can interact with the bot.   Here's a support article for your reference: https://attendancebot.freshdesk.com/a/solutions/articles/17000120333     Give this a try & let me know if you need help.   Cheers  Aaron

Prompt: Is it possible to give another user Admin permissions?
Completion: Hi Darryl,     Thanks for reaching out to us over the chat.     Yes, you can assign more than one admin for your AttendanceBot from the settings panel, just type 'Settings' in the app & follow the link to the dashboard & navigate to the administrator section & add the user as a secondary admin. I've attached a sample snapshot for your reference.      Cheers  Aaron

Prompt: Hello, I am having a problem verifying one of my Personnel's hours. How can I view the time's when an Employee punched their time cards? Can you tell me if Jaris Polly backlogged any hours for March after April 4th?
Completion: Hi Corey,     Yes you can definitely check if your employee Jaris has added any hours for March. Just head to the dashboard --> Time tracking --> Edit timesheet. Select the date range of March and click on the "Expand" button on the date tile. If Jaris has added/edited the time, you will get remarks with the date and time on it.         Cheers,  Thea

Prompt: I am missing an employee, are we limited to 3 people on Free?
Completion: Hi Evan,     AttendanceBot is free up to 5 users post which you would have to subscribe to our plans. So you can add 2 more employees additionally and still continue to be on the free plan.      You can check out inactive users in the app by heading to the dashboard --> People --> Personnel --> Toggle off "Show active personnel only". Once you switch it off, you can see all the employee, active/inactive on the page and simple click "Active" to activate the employee and they can start interacting with the app    Can you give this a try?   Cheers,  Thea

Prompt: logged in at 9:00 am
Completion: Hi Jahnavi,     I believe you want to add a punch for 9 am today. You would need to edit your timesheet by typing "Edit timesheet" and following the URL prompted.     Once you click on the URL, you will be redirected to the dashboard. head to your timesheet --> select today's date --> add punches --> Add punch in and select the time as 9 am.     ​   Can you give this a try?   Cheers,  Thea

Hi Matt,

Thanks for reaching out to us over the chat.

We've investigated your punch-in issue & found out that the Read Slack Status setting and Update Status On Checkin settings are enabled for your team because of which status is getting updated and on that basis, the app is punching IN again and again.

Cheers,
Aaron

Completion: Hi Ryan,     In this case, I suggest you ask your users to change their Slack status manually instead of AttendanceBot changing it, this will ensure that their status is updated & they don't get punched in repetedly.    Cheers  Aaron

Completion:
Hello,



Last week I sent the proposal for the CEO Interview Series given the number
of reviews under your GoodFirms profile. I haven’t heard from you since and
just wanted to drop in to see that you received it and if you had any
questions?



The interview procedure is quite simple to undergo.



●I'll mail you/your CEO the questionnaire which your CEO can answer & send
back to me.

●Once I receive the interview, we'll go through it & post it on our website.

●Once published, we can discuss having a summary article written by
GoodFirms for you to publish on your website.

Would you like to participate?

●Please write back with your consent & I'll share the questionnaire in my
next email. It's Free of cost.



Looking forward to your response.

Best Regards,

Jeena

Marketing Strategist

Team GoodFirms

www.goodfirms.co

Prompt: can i create a calendar view in a teams channel?
Completion: Hi Kathy,     Thanks for reaching out.     As it turns out, there's currently no way to create a calendar view in a team's channel. However, you could control the calendar configurations for employees by heading to AttendanceBot dashboard-->Vacations-->Calendar-->Team Calendar and click on "Configure". You and the employees would have access to the calendar on the dashboard as per the configuration set.      I have attached a few screenshots for your reference as well. Please give this a try and let me know if it works for you :)   Cheers,  Moira

Prompt: My timezone is set properly. My day is set for 8 hours starting at 9am. For some reason an afternoon off is showing up as 2-6pm rather than 1-5pm. The only thing I can find is that Google Calendar is showing (-4 Eastern Time) and Slack is showing (-5 Eastern Time). I've not had this problem with other apps though. What do I need to do? Thanks.
Completion: Hi Jason,     It will help if you set your Slack's timezone correctly to America/New York for AttendanceBot to work correctly. The timezone on your Google calendar is working fine but as the timezone on Slack is off, AttendanceBot is picking up the wrong time as it syncs with Slack and gets data from Slack. Once you rectify the timezone on your Slack profile, click on the re-sync button present in the personnel tab and it should work fine in the app as well :)     Can you give this a try? And if it's still not working as desired, I will ask my engineering team and get it checked.    Cheers,  Thea

Prompt: Hi, Is it possible to manage the same team from slack and team as well?
Completion: Hi Maciej,     Thanks for reaching out.     Whenever AttendanceBot is installed on any platform i.e Slack/MS Teams/ Gchat - an account or a team would be created for the same. If it is downloaded on 2 different platforms - then different accounts would be created and hence would require you to make changes/updates on them separately.     We recommend you install it on one platform to avoid ambiguity in data and to keep the process seamless. If you prefer, we can get on a quick call to answer this or any other queries that you might be having. You can schedule one at this link below:     https://calendly.com/customer-success-harmonize/attendancebot-demo?utm_source=cs&utm_medium=chat&utm_campaign=PRI   Cheers,  Moira

Prompt: My overtime setting won't allow me to select weekly overtime. It's greyed out.
Completion: Hi Catalina,     First of all, welcome to AttendanceBot :)     The reason weekly overtime is greyed out is that you have enabled "TOIL" and it's applicable for daily overtime only. If you wish to set up weekly overtime, you need to toggle off TOIL.      Cheers,  Thea

Completion: Hi Carol,     I can see that yesterday, you have deleted Marie's leaves that she had applied for October (13 days). As you deleted them, it got added back to her leave balance. Please check the screenshot.     ​   That's why her balance is now 17 days. If you wish to make her PTO balance to 12, just head to her profile --> quotas and balances --> adjustments --> subtract 5 days and hit save.   ​New balance will start reflecting :) Can you please give this a try?   Cheers,  Thea

Completion: Hi Suzanne,     Thanks for reaching out to us.      I would like to understand the context for future accrual? do you mean upcoming months for this year or are you referring to next year?      Also, you can enable the "Negative balance" button for your employees to request PTO even if they don't have the required leave balance. However, even if the PTO is for 2023, the balance will be deducted from this year. For eg: if the employee applies for leave in 2023, the PTO balance will be deducted from 2022.    Cheers,  Thea

Prompt: I want AttendanceBot to automatically send out a chat (or something proactive) to each employee each day in the morning, asking the team members to enter their plans for the day.     Is this possible?

Prompt: Does AttendanceBot have the capability for a manager (who is not an administrator) to get a leave report of all his/her direct and indirect reportees. Indirect reportees are reportee's reportees.      The "team report" command seems to generate report on direct reportees only.
Completion: Hi Song,     You are right. Currently, we support leave reports for direct reporters only. The admin has the right to download the report of the entire team and for managers, it's just their direct reporters.     Cheers,  Thea

Prompt: Hello,  i've just started my free trial using attendanceBot through Slack.  My biggest question is does the software track inactivity, for example what prevents my remote employee from just clocking in, going to the beach for the day, then clocking out later in the day?  Will there be some sort of inactive report or something?
Completion: Hi Russell,     I am afraid we don't track the activity on the device nor do we have geo-tagging as a feature.     Cheers,  Thea

Prompt: Hello! We have a unique situation where we only need the timeclock capability for one team member, not 20. Can the billing be altered?
Completion: Hi Nicole,     You can control who can use the app using the dashboard. Just type "Settings" to the app and follow the URL. Once you are on it, head to people --> personnel --> profile of the user, click on "Inactive" and they will be deactivated from the team.   ​  Just make sure the manager of the active employee also remains active for them to download the reports of the employee.     Cheers,  Thea

Prompt: Hello, We have a 40 hour work week. Anything between 40 to 44 hours in banked and time off instead of pay but anything over 44 hours is paid at 1.5x. How do I program this? When I enable toil overtime is greyed out.
Completion: Hi Catalina,     Weekly Overtime is greyed out because TOIL is only applicable for daily overtime.   You can set up an overtime alert when the employee reaches the 44 hours threshold to manage 1.5x pay and for 40-44 work hours, you can manually add the leave balance for the employee.   Cheers,  ​Thea

Prompt: Where can I find remarks in Timesheet?
Completion: Hi Kashima,     ​You can check these remarks on the dashboard and timesheet report as well.   On dashboard: just head to time tracking --> edit timesheet.       Timesheet report: There is a dedicated column for remarks and when the employee adds the remarks, it will reflect in the "Remark" column.    Cheers,  Thea

Hi Sarah,

I did have a few questions!


  1.  We have employees that are paid hourly, but most are salaried. Can I set up a notification for just the hourly employees to clock in and out?
  2.  The reports that come up in Slack are a little confusing. Is there a report I can run that will just give me the number of leave days that each employee has used YTD? I know I can schedule reports, but I’m wondering if there’s an option to run it instantly. We have unlimited leave, but still want to monitor how many days each employee is using.
  3.  I back-entered leave days from this year going back to January. If I mis-entered one of those entries, is there a way I can go back and edit it?
  4.  Is there a way to make the default screen for timesheets only show one employee “Office” or “Department”? Completion: Hi Melissa,     Thanks for getting back to me. We offer4 major capabilities in the system  1) Track employee records (profile) - employee meta data, their records like w2 and performance review records, extra data like food allergy, T-shirt size etc 2) Time off - you setup the rules (personal days, vacation, sick etc) and then people apply  3) Time tracking - use for doing payroll for hourly folks or just keeping track of how much time are people working or going a level deeper to understand how much time are people spending on different projects so that you know which projects are a time suck and which ones are smooth sailing 4) Shift scheduling - setup when folks work and provide them additional context for work like if someone is doing customer support they might do it via email on one day and twitter the next While the system is paid (https://www.attendancebot.com/pricing/), it comes with a free trial of 14 days and if your team size is below 5, it's for free.   ​   I am confident that we are easier to use and if you have any questions, please let me know, I am right here!   Cheers,  Thea

Prompt: two questions: 1) can I track time to projects using the Standard plan? 2) we are going to start with only 3 users...can I reduce my user count from 8 to 3?
Completion: Hi Paul,     Thanks for reaching out.     1. Project tracking is a part of PRO plan only and cannot be accessed if you subscribe to a Standard Plan.     2. You can control the status of the users to be active or inactive in this case. Only Active users would be able to interact with AttendanceBot. For switching their status, follow this step wise guide : https://attendancebot.freshdesk.com/a/solutions/articles/17000093807     3. AttendanceBot is free for teams with 5 active users or less, meaning such teams get access to the highest tier plan PRO for free. For teams with more than 5 active users, you get a free trial of 14 days post which you would need to subscribe to a paid plan.      Please give this a try and let me know if this works for you :)   Cheers,  Moira

Prompt: Hi, here's me again! However, for Priscilla - I see that the last leave (for 6th June) was approved by you on 30th May and she hasn't applied for any leave post that.     Can you provide me with a latest example (after the managers have been updated), where leave applied by employee has'nt gone to their direct manager ? This would help our engineering team to investigate this further.   Cheers,  Moira

Hello,

I noticed one of our employees recently had leave approved for next January 2023, and it affected this year's balance instead of next years, when it resets on January 1.

How do we manage this?
Completion: Hi Lyle,     Hope you had a great weekend :)     You would be required to migrate your account to MS Teams and will transfer the data of your account that includes punches and vacation request. However, you can't have one AttendanceBot account on two different platforms.      Talking about the vacation balance of your employee, the leave will be deducted from this year's balance only. This is by design and something we can't alter. The only workaround for the employee can be applying for leave next year or HR can make a note and manually deduct the no of leave days in near year's balance.    Cheers,  Thea

You can switch it off and it's done. You can disable it using the settings panel. Please type "Settings" to the app and follow the URL prompted. Once you open it, head to time tracking --> general time settings --> punch settings.        Also, once the employees start the tour of the app, it asks them to setup the manager and it seems like your employees typed "NA" instead of the username of the manager. They can change their manage by typing "Change manager" to the app followed by the username of the new manager.      ​Does this help?    Cheers,  Thea

Prompt: Can I adjust the vacations per anniversary? At solvento, when people increase a year working for us, they get two more vacation days.
Completion: Hi Sofia,     ​Welcome to AttendanceBot :)     I can see that you have already enabled the accrual setting as per the employee's work anniversary. You can also create a workflow which is tenure based wherein in you can setup the max tenure (in months) and add the accrued days accordingly.   For this, please head to dashboard by typing "Settings" to the app and click on the URL prompted. Once you are on it, please go to vacation management --> leaves --> leave types and quotas --> vacation --> accruals settings --> create new set.   ​   Once you click on that, you have to select "tenure" as an option and select the tenure that mins - max as the condition and add the accrual days you wish to add :) I am sharing an article as well that can help you setup the accruals: https://attendancebot.freshdesk.com/a/solutions/articles/17000051255  ​   If you want, we can also schedule a demo for you wherein we can walk you through the entire process and also explain features associated with it. You can book a demo by clicking here    Cheers,  Thea

Prompt: How do I trial the remote work feature as that is the key part I want to try?
Completion: Hi Mark,     Welcome to AttendanceBot :)     Employee need to mark "Work from home" as a leave type to update that working location. However, you have disabled the vacation management feature. Please go to the dashboard by typing "Settings" and click on the URL. Once you open it, under settings, check "Both" as the active feature set    Once you go that, your employees can start marking their working location by typing "Work from home today" or "Work from home on monday" Here's an article on how they can mark it: https://attendancebot.freshdesk.com/a/solutions/articles/17000067588  ​  Does this help?   Cheers,  Thea

Prompt: hey how do i change another users department (i am an admin btw)
Completion: Hey there,     Hope your AttendanceBot trial is progressing well :)     You can update the department in profile of the user using the settings panel.   Please type "settings" to the app and click on the URL. Once you open the dashboard, head to people --> personnel page --? Select the profile you wish to make the edit by clicking on the name. Pick the department from the drop down menu and hit save.    Can you give this a try?   Cheers,  Thea

Completion: Hi Hendry,     Our billing system verifies the number of users active in your account couple of days before your subscription is due for renewal and charges accordingly. In your case, it seems like guests users were also marked active in your team and ExpenseTron picked it as active users. I suggest you deactivate the profile of these users to avoid such instances.      Here's how to can do it:   Please type "Settings" as a direct message to the app and click on the link. Once you open the dashboard, head to people tab present on the left panel --> personnel. Toggle off the button present under the active column. Please check the screenshot below    Talking about the refund, considering you have 7 members who will be using the app, the pricing will be $3 * 7 users * 12 months = $252 + $228 (Base fee) = $480. As you have already made the payment for $1272, we will be refunding $792 to your account.      I have initiated the refund process from our end and it will take 5-10 business days to reflect in your account :)   Cheers,  Thea

Prompt: In our account, we have set all leave types to auto-approve.  However, whenever someone sets a status  - even "working from home today" - their manager gets a notification.     This page: https://www.attendancebot.com/accounts/leave/approval/ shows that there is no approval flow, but does appear to show that notifications will flow to the Direct Manager, or we can set all approvals to go to 1 specific person.     There is a settings link beneath that to https://www.attendancebot.com/accounts/leave/quotas/     What we are looking for (and doesn't appear to exist) is the ability to set manager notifications by leave type. For example, managers don't want to get notified of "work from home", "work from office" or "Business travel" but do want notifications for "sick" and "vacation".       Where/how do we set that?
Completion: Hi Andrew,  Thank you for explaining your situation. Unfortunately, there isn't a way to turn off manager notification for certain leave types.      One potential workaround can be that since all leave types for you are auto-approve, everyone can set themselves as their own manager and then you create a channel where you can announce the "sick" and "vacation" days and all managers or perhaps everyone in the company can be a member of that. Alternatively, managers can rely on the calendar where you can sync just the "sick/vacation" days.     ​Happy to get on a call to understand your needs further so that I can go back to the product team with your feedback and get it added to our product roadmap.   ​    Cheers  Kanav

Prompt: How can I remove accrual type by employee?
Completion: Hi Kathy,     You can delete employee level accrual settings by heading to profile --> quotas and balances --> select the leave type that has employee level accrual set and click on the right arrow next to it.    ​  You will be directed to the settings box and select "Delete employee level change" and hit save.   Note: The settings will be deleted for that specific leave type only   Cheers   Thea

Once you open the dashboard, please head to settings --> API key    ​   You can also generate report using the commands in AttendanceBot itself. Just type "Report" to the app and click on "Generate report". You will be re-directed to the dashboard wherein you can download the different types of reports.       Cheers  Thea

Prompt: Is there any way to have an option on the calendar view to have a colored bar appear over multiple days off and to have notes visible - for the use of knowing who's covering that shift for that time off?
Completion: Hi Amanda,     We do have dedicated colour assigned to a specific leave type in the calendar and the notes included the comments added by the employees while applying leave for eg: if an employee applies for vacation, green colour indexes the vacation leave. When he/she is requesting leave, they can add comments like travelling to Miami. This note will be visible when you click on the vacation.      However, these notes wont have the details of the person covering the shift as a replacement. If the employee is aware about it, he/she can add it in the comment section and it will reflect on the calendar   Cheers  ​Thea

Completion: Hi Michelle,     Thea here.      Let me explain what happened here: I was in touch with your colleague Simon for changing the current Annual plan to monthly. Your annual renewal was due on 10th of Sept and the credit card had expired. The billing system was re-trying to charge your card since 10th however it was failing but we made sure your account doesn't get closed. Your colleague Simon reached out to us on 17th Sept for the change in plans. Since the payment for annual didn't go through for 7 days, I gave a grace period till 21st Sept until I have a confirmation from Simon so that your team can continue using the app without any interruptions   ​   In my last email, I mentioned that once the credit card details are updated, I can create a fresh subscription. He did update the card details and before the change to monthly plan reflected, the pending charge for Annual plan went through.      Here's the next step:  As you have decided to go for monthly plan, I am deducting the money for this month (41 users * $6 per user = $246) and refunding the differential charges i.e $1968 - $246 = $1476 to your card.    Cheers  Thea

While I have been testing AttendanceBot for a while, there are a couple of issues that are preventing me from rolling it out to my team.

The other thing it to look at how ‘time off in lieu’ is worked out. From my testing it would be great if someone worked less than their working hours in a week that it automatically reduced their TOIL balance. Perhaps this could be a ‘Flexitime’ mode that is enabled, as I know it wouldn’t work in all environments.

This would be useful as my team cover events that could take place over evenings and weekends. So I get them to balance their time over a Monday to Sunday window – with the ability to accrue TOIL if workload doesn’t allow them to flex their time.

Prompt: Hi AttendanceBot Support,     I'm about to recommend that all our staff begin using the "cal" command to link our AttendanceBot to our Outlook Calendars. This will have a significant benefit for us. However, when I link the Outlook calendar it mentions that it will set the out of office auto-reply as well and it does not appear to be doing so.     The good news is that this is perfect and I don't want it to, but I'm not sure if that is the case just for me or if others will have their out of office auto-replies set and I should include some way to enable or disable this function.     My question: Is there a way to enable and disable the out of office auto-reply functionality in AttendanceBot's Outlook integration?     Thank you!     Jeremy Higgins   CRC Endpoint Services   Stanford | University IT   650.725.HELP(4357)   Request Support: http://services.stanford.edu
Completion: Hi Jeremy,     We were discussing your case and our engineering informed us that auto reply in case of personal calendar integration gets trigged by the employee. So, once an employee integrates personal calendar, he/she will get an additional button everytime a leaves gets approved “Set Auto reply”. Once its clicked and a reply is added, it's synced to outlook calendar.   So, there is no way to disable that button as of now but its user triggered operation, so they can avoid using the button altogether.    Cheers  Thea

The second thing is: I have set our account to do both Vacation and Time Tracking multiple times but it keeps defaulting back to just Vacation tracking.
Completion: Hi Tivo,     Please share the name of your colleague who isn't present in the personnel page and I'll get it checked :)   Talking about your second question, I can see that currently, your feature set is marked for both - time tracking and vacation management. Can you tell me when did you run into the app defaulting the feature set to vacation management?    Cheers  Thea

Completion: Hi Dustin,     You are subscribed to Annual Standard plan and it doesn't include leave accruals and quotas as a feature set. Prompt: HI, I am trying to import our employees balances but keep getting an error message
Completion: Hi Laura,     The excel sheet that you uploaded has the employees that are not marked active on AttendanceBot dashboard which is why the balances are not getting imported. You need to activate the profiles of your employees and re-try uploading the balances.      Here's how to can activate their profile:   Please open the settings panel by typing "Settings" as a direct message to AttendanceBot and click on the URL prompted. Once you open the dashboard, please head to people --> personnel tab --> click on "Active" button present on the profile tile of the employee.   ​     Cheers  Thea

Prompt: Is it possible to see which channel a person is clocking into? Say for example #general?
Completion: Hi Tom,     Employees have to mark their punches by typing "In" or "Out" as a direct message to the app. You can setup notifications to the Slack channel wherein these punches can be announced.   Here's how you can do that:   Please open the settings panel by typing "Settings" as a direct message to AttendanceBot and click on the URL prompted. Once you open the dashboard, please head to notifications --> channel notifications --> create new. Select "in/out notifications" and all the relevant details and hit save changes     Cheers  Thea

Prompt: Hi, my PTO is supposed to be accrued at 1 day per month.  Up to 12 days earned in a calendar year.  If an employee's start date is not at the beginning of the calendar year, the current settings still show them alloted PTO for that month.  It should be reduced if they didn't work that month.  How can I update the system to reflect this accurately?
Completion: Hi Sarah,     Happy to help. When configuring your PTO leave type from your dashboard, on the accrual tab you'll see a toggle near the bottom that says "Enable Pro Rata" -- assuming you accrue by calendar year, turning this on means that employees who join mid-year will only get a pro rated amount of PTO (ie not the full amount).      Regarding your other ticket, if you have an employee that leaves and rejoins, I'd advise you re-set their join date to the more recent hire data so pro-rata works automatically. If you then want to add additional balance for any PTO they still had before they left, you can go to their personnel file and directly add/subtract balance from Quotas & Balance > PTO > Adjustments.     Let me know if you still have questions!

Prompt: Hi, my PTO is supposed to be accrued at 1 day per month.  Up to 12 days earned in a calendar year.  If an employee's start date is not at the beginning of the calendar year, the current settings still show them alloted PTO for that month.  It should be reduced if they didn't work that month.  How can I update the system to reflect this accurately?
Completion: Hi Sarah,     Let's say annual leave count is 12 and accrual period is monthly, AttendanceBot will pro-rate leaves if employee has not joined at the start of the year and he will be allotted his PTO days accordingly. There's no way to reduced if they didn't work that month.      Also, about the employee who left, he would get the allocation from his joining date pro-rated for the year   Cheers  Thea

Prompt: Hi AB Support Team, Could you let me know how we can stop staff from making recurring requests for specific leave types, e.g., wfh every tuesday  Issue - In the above example, a staff who made a "wfh every tuesday" request a while back may have forgotten and each week registering a new wfh request each. Completion: Hi Apurva,     Let me see what's possible. In the meantime, would any of the below processes help?    Direct staff not to use recurring leave, and ask them to type "delete" to see if they have existing AttendanceBot recurrences they need to delete    ​If you suspect any user has a recurrence, an admin (or manager) can message "delete @username" and that users recurring leave will show up at the top (where you can delete it yourself if preferred)     ​

Hi Conor,

While you continue to explore possibilities with AttendanceBot, I thought you'd appreciate 4 quick tips to help hasten your discovery.
1.     Get some teammates involved - AttendanceBot is truly a team tool, so its magic takes root with scale. Chat ‘introduce’ to the bot to start building your pilot team.
2.     Browse command options - message 'cheat sheet' to bring up a list of common commands. As an admin, you can even tailor this document to your team!
3.     Customize your experience - Have you explored the settings panel yet? From reminders and permissions to custom leaves  and approval workflow to project and client tracking, you can customize pretty much everything. Just message ‘settings’ to get behind the scenes.
4.     Announcements - Add @attendancebot to a team to stay in the loop with who's clocked in, who's on break, who has upcoming time off, who has a birthday, or your own custom reminders.

There is - of course - plenty more to consider like permissions, smart reminders, and calendar or payroll integration, but these tips should be enough to warm up the engines.

As always, I'm here for any questions you have, or you can schedule a quick call<https://t.dripemail2.com/c/eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..4Erf03T5QyG100Gb3GMP0opeO24bt7B0qOfPjmaZgIQ> to dive deeper on any of these topics.

support@attendancebot.freshdesk.com> wrote:

> Hi Marina,
>
> I spoke to our product team and after few sessions of brainstorming, we
> have a solution for your team :)
>
> There's a simple command "Delegate @username" which will give you
> temporary access to look up for all the pending leaves of your CEO
>
> ​Here's a detailed explanation on how this will work out for you:
>
> 1) Type: change delegate @username (@CEO in your case) then after the
> prompt type @username (@yourownname in your case)
> This process allows you to temporarily delegate approval access to another
> user, including yourself
>
> 2) Type: pending - this pulls up all leaves pending your approval + those
> you're waiting for. Once you're the CEO's delegate, this command brings up
> all leaves pending for him as well.
> You can approve and reject leaves as needed in this step.
>
> 3) Type: change delegate @username (@CEO in your case) then after the
> prompt type na to remove the delegate permissions
> This will ensure that all new approval requests still notify the CEO, even
> if you later approve on his behalf
>
> Cheers
> Thea

Prompt: i cant figure out how to complete our toil settings. I want to give toil on any overtime hours worked. This should accrue monthly or weekly. I have enabled "overtime for time off" in the TOIL Test vacation but i am not sure if this works.
Completion: Hi Nadia,     TOIL can be availed when employees works overtime and the extra hours are banked at that very moment when they hit their daily work hours. They can't be accrued weekly or monthly.     Cheers  Thea

Prompt: i cant figure out how to complete our toil settings. I want to give toil on any overtime hours worked. This should accrue monthly or weekly. I have enabled "overtime for time off" in the TOIL Test vacation but i am not sure if this works.
Completion: Hi Nadia,     Happy to help, though I'm also happy to set up a support call for you if you need further assistance.     Looking at your "TOIL test" it looks like the last missing piece is "how do OT hours translate to vacation hours?"     Basically, you need to fill in Rate of Earning section so the blue sentence accurately describes whether TOIL is 1:1 or some other ratio.     Does that make sense?

Cheers  Thea

Prompt:
Hello,
I was talking to Dakota about a new PTO policy we want to implement next
year with hourly accrual, but since he's OOO, I thought I could ask you
quickly.

I had asked him this: "*We have a couple of people who already requested
2-3 days off in January, and they won't have accrued those days by the time
they need the time off - so can we override the system somehow in these
cases?"*

And he responded: "

*Yes! Two options:- Cleanest: you enable negative balances for PTO, say
with a limit of 3 negative days.- Most specific: you can also set an
individual-level PTO policy giving ONLY these employees the option to have
a negative balance. Only risk here is once the individual policy is create,
it is henceforth "untethered" to the broader team PTO, so if you even make
change to PTO policy you'll need to remember to either A) delete the
individual-level policy, or B) make the same changes to the individual
policy.*"

So my question is re: the first option -- would that be 3 full days for
each person based on their actual shift length, rather than say 24 hours
(based on 8 hour shifts)?

Thanks!
Completion: Hi Carol,     3 days will be assumed to be 8 hours as the work hours are defined in AttendanceBot and not 24 hours :)    Cheers  Thea

Prompt: How is attendanceBot different from Channel Calendar? What is the price for AttendanceBot or Channel Calendar?
Completion: Hi Alice,     AttendanceBot helps you track the hours works by your employees and manage leaves of your team.      To expand on what AttendanceBot does:  1) Time off - you setup the rules (personal days, vacation, sick etc) and then people apply  2) Time tracking - use for doing payroll for hourly folks or just keeping track of how much time are people working or going a level deeper to understand how much time are people spending on different projects so that you know which projects are a time suck and which ones are smooth sailing.      AttendanceBot is an app you need to install in your MS Teams and it has 3 plans with various features. If you opt for Annual plan, you save flat 20% discount :)    Cheers  Thea

All you need to do is just confirm and we will charge you the differential amount i.e $45.      ​Your thoughts?    Cheers  Thea

Prompt: Is there a way to setup a portion of the users to require approvals and some not ?  either by manager, department or office -  or salary or hourly worker?     Also is there a way tp provide a reminder notification to the submitter after a they  submit their request?
Completion: Hi Anna,     You can disable "Approval required" for employee by using the dashboard. Just head to their profile --> quotas and balance --> select leave type and click on the forward arrow. You can then disable "Approval required" tab and that employee will no longer require approval for that leave type.     Also, do you mean that an employee gets a reminder notification after they apply for leave? can you expand on the use case of reminder notification?  ​  Cheers  Thea

I have by mistake paid for 12 months for 2 more employees who had resigned
recently.
kindly refund the amount for the same.


Regards
AKS
Completion: Hi Arunkumar,     In Annual plan, the credits are allocated at the start of the subscription. Incase your employees leave, you need to deactivate the profiles of these users and then these credits gets adjusted automatically in case of removing users from your team.      In your case, when you remove existing employees, the credits allocated to you are utilised against the new total users in your team and your subscription gets extended automatically and you can continue to use AttendanceBot post the completion of your 1 year contract from your initial payment date.    Cheers  Thea

Prompt: One of our managers, Michael Conde, is showing as clocked out last night and clocked in again this morning on the Admin Panel, but the Slack integration shows that he went on lunch break instead of clocking out.   The Time Sheet also shows 0:00 break, so we are confused why it lists him as at lunch. Can you explain this and do we need to worry about it?
Completion: Hi Amy,     We have checked the punches from our end and found out the Michael had received a lunch reminder to which he responded with yes.   When an employee clicks on lunch, AttendanceBot clocks him/her out. After lunch, he never punched in which is why break hours has not been added in the app. If he would have punched in, the break hour would have been calculated and added in his timesheet.      The other day, he punched in normally and the app started recording the hours.    Cheers  Thea

Prompt: Changing Manger

Prompt: i only need 1 user per month to log time, how can i change it to sign up
Completion: Hi William,     You can deactivate the rest of the team and just keep the profile of that employee and the admin of the account active on the AttendanceBot dashboard.      Here's how you can do that:   Please open the settings panel by typing "Settings" as a direct message to AttendanceBot and click on the URL prompted. Once you open the dashboard, please head to people --> personnel tab --> click on "Inactive" button present on the profile tile of the employee. These employees wont be able to use the app then.       Cheers  ​Thea

Prompt: Please cancel my account. We do not wish to renew.     Thank you,     --Chris Sibley
Completion: Hi Chris,     We feel bad to let you go :(  We have worked really hard to serve you but sometimes things fall through the cracks.  If you wouldn't mind, can you please let us know the reason for the cancellation so that we can work on it and make sure it doesn't happen again?  Any suggestions or feedback for us that will make us a better fit for your team?    Cheers  Thea

Prompt: Feedback for:  Inactivate users on AttendanceBot  Need more information   How to suppress a user (an employee who left the company) ?
Completion: Hi Olivier,     Has the user been removed from Slack entirely? If so, you should be able to use the "re-sync" button to remove the user.     Regardless of whether that successfully removes the user entirely, you should be able to easily search the user under "personnel" and inactivate as needed.     Does this accomplish suppression as desired?        Cheers

Prompt:
If I apply for time off and it is accepted, how can I make sure that updates my google calendar?

Is that possible?
Completion: Hi Aaron,     You need to integrate your calendar and the events will be updated. All you need to do is type "Cal" as a direct message to the app and enable the link prompted.      Here's an article that has detailed steps: https://attendancebot.freshdesk.com/a/solutions/articles/17000118246    Cheers  Thea

Prompt: Hi,     we have 4 admins, is it possible to check the pending leaves from other managers (admins)? Use case: A manager get's sick and no access to slack and has pending leave requests, how can we get that insight and pick these requests up?
Completion: Hi Hans,     ​We have a setting wherein the managers can set a delegate manager in the absence.   ​  The manager needs to type "change delegate @username" username of the new manager. Once the delegate is set, the new manager can type "Pending leaves" and he/she will get the list of leaves that are pending for approval.      Once the manager is back from their leave, they have to type "change delegate @username" username being their own username and then after the prompt type na to remove the delegate permissions   Cheers  Thea

Prompt: how do i cancel someones PTO for an employee?

Prompt:
How can I as admin can grant our employees the permission to update Slack Status?
 
I see that it is requested individually to the employees, but some don't have it somehow, and I would prefer having it On for everyone.
Completion: Hi Adrian,     Unfortunately Slack requires those permissions to be managed at the individual level, so there's not much we can do from our end.     That said, it should be easy to see anyone who hasn't synced their status (they should display as in/out or on leave) and if you need I believe we can provide a list of employees who haven't yet synced their status.  ​   Hope this help!

Prompt: how do i add new users to this system?
Completion: Hi Ouriel,     All you need to do is add them to your Slack workspace and their profile will be synced to AttendanceBot.   You can look them up on the dashboard by heading to people tab --> personnel and search for their name. Incase they still don't show up, please toggle off "Show active personnel only" present in the personnel tab and you will find them. Just click on the "Active" button present on the profile tile and they can start using the app.      If you are still unable to find them, just let me know their name and email id and I'll look up for you.    Cheers  Thea

Prompt: When can people start submitting leave requests for the next year? They are out of days for this year, but it's not letting them submit vacation for after their accrual resets.
Completion: Hi Ashley,     I have enabled a setting for your team wherein they can now apply leaves for the upcoming year and it will be deducted from their future accrued balance.     Cheers  Thea

Prompt:
Hi Sarah & Dakota,

Good day!

Understand Pranav has left the organisation, could you send us the data
import link for importing leave balance?

Thanks,
Chanel
Completion:
Hi Chanel,

Looping in Saurabh as a good POC going forward.

Regards leave balances, we typically keep the bulk upload page hidden to
avoid mistakes. That said, a few options you have:

   - Our preference is that you share bulk changes with us and we can
   ingest from our end
   - Alternatively, we *can* expose the bulk-upload to admin users if
   you're comfortable with that, but do note we can't take responsibility for
   mistaken edits. We will of course help resolve these mistakes but fair
   warning.
   - If it's just a few users you want to edit, it's easiest to do so
   manually for each employee. Happy to send a video showing you how!

Let us know how you'd like to proceed,

Dakota <https://www.linkedin.com/in/dakota-lafee/>
Head of Growth

AttendanceBot is designed for organizations that use Slack or Microsoft Teams to communicate internally, providing any easy way to manage PTOs, time in/out of the office, as well as to track time to projects/clients/tasks from within these platforms.   ​  May I ask whether your team is on Slack or Microsoft Teams?     Cheers  Thea

Prompt: how to add user in attendencebot?

Cheers  Thea

Prompt: Edit Leave Time
Completion: Hi Kendall,  ​   You can edit the punches but not the leave. To make changes to an applied leave, type "delete" as a direct message to the app and you'll see all your upcoming leaves listed with a "delete" option below each of them. You may delete and re-apply the leave accordingly.      Here's an article to guide you through :)   Cheers  Thea

Completion: Sorry to hear that Lukas. If you don’t mind, I would like to know the reason for deleting, so that we can work on it and improve based on your feedback :)   Cheers  Thea

Prompt: I am trying to create one leave type for vacation but allow different staff members to have different yearly allocation of days ... is this possible
Completion: Hi Ross,     Yes, you can certainly set different accruals for different staffs. All you need to do is -     1) Create a leave type: Head to “Leaves” under Vacation Management on the dashboard. Click on “Leave types and Quotas” and create a new leave type.       2) To set staff-based accruals: Go to "Personnel" under People on the dashboard. You'll see your staff list displayed here. Click on the staff you want to set the accrual -> click on "Quotas and Balance" tab, you'll see the leave types you have created. You can get into each leave type options to set the accruals.        And regards to calendar integration, calendar can be integrated with Google, Outlook and Apple. Here's an article to guide you through :)   Cheers  Thea

Completion: Hi Yonat,     I see "Auto Invite Users" option is enabled for your team, so the new team members will receive an introductory message from AttendanceBot explaining how to use it. Otherwise to start with, you can cover the basics like how to punch for in/out/break/lunch, apply for leaves, delete leave requests, to view their timesheet and quota balances.   Hope this should be good to get started :)    Cheers  Rose

Prompt:
Is there a way to track tardy/late arrivals?  Early Departures?

The gusto integration, does it update the gusto timesheets or just reports to the next payroll the hours?
Completion: Hi Timothy,     You can enable "Highlight late arrivals" option to get notified about late arrivals on in/out notifications, punchboard, timesheet, and the timesheet report. Head to Time tracking-> General time settings-> under Other settings-> Highlight late arrivals.     You can also generate timesheet summary to view the in/out durations to track early departures. Type in 'report' as dm to app, and app will prompt a couple of options- choose report type as timesheet summary, set rest according to your requirement and click on confirm to generate report.

Prompt: I would like to know if AttendanceBot can be used for supervisors to document attendance, rather than employees signing in/out on their own? We are running retail stores, our managers are on teams, but retail salespeople are not. We are looking for a system that is better than excel, to build weekly/monthly schedules and document attendances, hours, time off, vacations or AWP/AWOP.
Completion: Hi Greg,     You can certainly build weekly/monthly shifts, track attendance through timesheets, manage time offs and leave quotas and much more through AttendanceBot. All this administrative actions require employees to punch in and out and the managers cannot do this on behalf of the employees.    Cheers  Rose

Prompt: I've moved some leave types to be inactive and created a new one to match our new PTO policy. Still, I cannot add the keyboards (such as vacation) because they are already assigned to a previous policy, even tho I've removed them from the old policies.
Completion: Hi Steve,     Happy to help. It sounds like you found the keyword editor, which is located at the top when you open a leave type for editing.     If you've already removed keywords (like vacation) then my guess is that the name itself for inactivated leave types is causing the issue - leave type name is the primary keyword, so if you have a "vacation" leave type - even deactivated - you will no longer be able to use "vacation" elsewhere. I'd recommend deleting altogether OR just repurposing since you can rename and leave type.     If you'd like assistance, all I need is the name of your Slack or Microsoft Teams workspace, along with a little additional context, and I can make the changes for you :)     Let me know!  Sarah

Hi Harlan,

While you continue to explore possibilities with AttendanceBot, I thought you'd appreciate 4 quick tips to help hasten your discovery.
1.     Get some teammates involved - AttendanceBot is truly a team tool, so its magic takes root with scale. Chat ‘introduce’ to the bot to start building your pilot team.
2.     Browse command options - message 'cheat sheet' to bring up a list of common commands. As an admin, you can even tailor this document to your team!
3.     Customize your experience - Have you explored the settings panel yet? From reminders and permissions to custom leaves  and approval workflow to project and client tracking, you can customize pretty much everything. Just message ‘settings’ to get behind the scenes.
4.     Announcements - Add @attendancebot to a team to stay in the loop with who's clocked in, who's on break, who has upcoming time off, who has a birthday, or your own custom reminders.

There is - of course - plenty more to consider like permissions, smart reminders, and calendar or payroll integration, but these tips should be enough to warm up the engines.

Cheers,
Sarah

Prompt: I still need some help with this program.  Specifically, changing managers and imputting leave times, how to request and approve
Completion: Hi Cynthia,     To change manager, type in "change manager" as a dm to the app. The app will ask you to select your manager from the employee dropdown. Once you select, your manager will be set and you can view the same by typing "my manager".       To apply for leave, type in "apply" as a dm to the app. Set the employee, leave type, leave duration and date from the dropdown when prompted and click on submit.     The leave request is notified to the employee's manager and the manger can either approve or deny the leave applied.      You may also get in touch with one of our product experts - they will walk you through the AttendanceBot settings and clarify on any questions you may have. Here's the link to schedule a time :)   Cheers  Rose

Prompt: Looking to see if we can integrate this into our church slack to help track expenses.  How are users calculated? Is it distinct user who submits an expense that month?

Prompt: For Admin, how to adjust the leave type for a past date?
Completion: Hi Juelu,     You can edit the leave type for the past leave now. All you can do is delete the old leave and apply a fresh leave for that date.   To delete the leave for a specific employee, they need to type "Delete @username" and they will get a list of old leaves. They need to click on delete button for the leave they want to remove.      Cheers  Thea

Prompt: I have an employee who took a break for nearly 5 hours in the middle of the day, and yet AttendanceBot is showing they are into overtime. Shouldn't overtime NOT kick in until actual working hours are more than 8 hours in a day?     This is not a weekly overtime--this employee has not worked close to 40 hours.       I would like to understand how overtime is calculated and then reported to the payroll provider please!
Completion: Hi Amy,     Angela hasn't worked for 8 hours however you can see that you have toggled a setting in time tracking that break hours are included in work hours which is why these hours too are added to her working hours.     If you wish to switch off the settings, just head to "general time settings" and toggle off "Include break hours"     Cheers  Thea

Prompt: Hi team,     How to send an automated message to Slack when somebody punches in/out?     Can't find the info so it's rather confusing for me.
Completion: Hi Ace,     You can set up channel notifications under which the working status of the employee is announced. Firstly, you need to invite the app in the Slack channel where you wish to announce. You need to type "/invite @attendancebot" as a direct message to the app and it will be added to the Slack channel.     Just open the settings panel by typing "Settings" as a direct message to AttendanceBot and click on the URL prompted. Once you open the dashboard, please head to notifications --> channel notifications --> create new. Select in/out notifications, pick the slack channel you want to announce from the drop down menu and hit save.      Cheers  Thea

Prompt: Hey, AttendanceBot. A new joiner needs help to punch in. A message shows her this every time she tries to punch in. She has done all the required steps, like typing the time she clocked out, but it's still telling her to. When I punch in, the same msg that I didn't punch out on 13feb comes
Completion: Hi Donna,     Can you tell me the name of the employee who is unable to punch and the message she is getting?     Also, we have rolled out a new feature wherein if you forget to punch out, next day when you punch in, AttendanceBot asks you to add the punch out time for previous day and only when you add the punch out time lets say 6 PM, you can clock the fresh punch in. This is to ensure the clocks are recorded correctly in the timesheet.    Cheers  Thea

Prompt: How can I approve another member leave? I have admin access.
Completion: Hi Wendy,     If the leave is pending approval, there's no way to directly approve as an admin. However if needed, you can use the following steps:   Delete @username_of_requester will display all leaves for the user including the requested leave -- delete this  Delegate @username_of_approver will allow you to set yourself as the temporary approver instead of that manager (just follow instructions)  ​Once you're the delegate, submit leave on behalf of the requester again (e.g. apply @username_of_requester)   You'll now receive the request -- approve it  Once complete, use delegate @username_of_approver again but reply with NA to reset delegation rights.    Cheers,  Sarah

Prompt: Hi,  as far as I can see, the Hybrid work seats calendar is the only screen where I can quickly see who has checked in office vs remote.  It also appears as if access to this screen view is disabled with the standard subscription?     Is there any other screen where I can get a quick glimpse of everyone who has checked in and see remote vs in office status?  I do not want remote or WFH people to appear as OUT, as they are working just from home or remote?
Completion: Hey Josh,     Hybrid work module is part of the "Pro" plan which is why it's greyed out for your team.      Also, you can type "punch card" as a direct message to the app and you can see the working status as in they are working or not. Even if the employees apply for working from home or remotely, they can still punch in to record their hours so if they are WFH and punch in, the punch card command will show up if they are in or out.    Cheers  Thea

Prompt: Hello how to have the system automatically clock in/out for a set period of time for lunch?
Completion: Hi Travis,     ​We currently don't have auto-punch in or out for lunch specifically however you can certainly reminder your employee to take time. You can setup the lunch notification using the settings dashboard.      Please open the settings panel by typing "Settings" as a direct message to AttendanceBot and click on the URL prompted. Once you open the dashboard, please head to notifications --> direct notifications --> create new. Select "punch reminder"    You can set fixed duration and the employees will be reminded to take lunch after they have clocked certain work hours like 4 hours.          ​  Cheers,  Thea

You can deactivate the profile of the rest of the team and just keep the profile of the admin in addition to these 2 employee's active.      Here's how you can do that:   Please open the settings panel by typing "Settings" as a direct message to AttendanceBot and click on the URL prompted. Once you open the dashboard, please head to people --> personnel tab --> click on "inactive" button present on the profile tile to deactivate the profile of the employee.   ​   Also, app is free to use upto 5 users so you don't need to subscribe to the app.    Cheers  Thea

Prompt: Hello. Does AttedanceBot manage time off balances and accrual? Does it only work within chat systems or does it have its own stand-alone platform?
Completion: Hi Alissa,     Welcome to AttendanceBot :)     AttendanceBot can help you tracking time and vacation requests of your employees. You can diffinetly assign leave quotas based on leave type or employee level and set different accrual periods like weekly, monthly or annually based on your company policy.      You can installed the app on Slack/ MS Teams or Hangout and use the app. We do have a independent web platform wherein you can login into AttendanceBot using website.    Cheers  Thea

Completion: Hi Normunds,     We have rolled out a new feature wherein if the user forgets the punch out yesterday, they have to first enter the time and then can punch in for the new day.  I have checked his logs and I can see that the app is expecting him to add a punch out time for 24th Feb. The message we are sending him is "It appears you forgot to punch OUT on 24 Feb. Your last punch IN was on 24 Feb at 09:12 AM. Before you can punch in, please state your OUT time for 24 Feb (e.g 6 PM)"  ​   He needs to type punch out first by responding with the time and then only can he punch in today  ​   Best,  Thea
